titleStmt.title: The hasty bride-groom. Or, The rarest sport that hath been try'd, between a lusty bride-groom and his bride. To the tune of, Pass his carrier: or, Bow-bells.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for A. Milbourn, W. Ownly, and T. Thackeary [sic].

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come from the temple away to the bed ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
